macros.sourceContext: | The HTMLSelectElement.checkValidity() method checks | whether the element has any constraints and whether it satisfies them. If the element > | fails its constraints, the browser fires a cancelable {{domxref("HTMLSelectElement/invalid_event", "invalid")}} event at the ^ | element, and then returns false. |

title: HTMLSelectElement: checkValidity() method
summary:
The HTMLSelectElement.checkValidity() method checks
  whether the element has any constraints and whether it satisfies them. If the element
  fails its constraints, the browser fires a cancelable invalid event at the
  element, and then returns false.
pageTitle: HTMLSelectElement: checkValidity() method - Web APIs | MDN
